title: Citi is the First Bank in Honduras with LEED Certification
summary: Tegucigalpa - Citi Honduras recently obtained gold-level LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certification for its new offices in Altia Business Park in San Pedro Sula. The building is the first in Honduras to be designed and built according to the highest environmental standards in an effort to earn LEED certification.
tag-1: Citi is the First Bank in Honduras with LEED Certification
tag-3: Tegucigalpa – Citi Honduras recently obtained gold-level LEED (Leadership in Energy and Environmental Design) certification for its new offices in Altia Business Park in San Pedro Sula. The building is the first in Honduras to be designed and built according to the highest environmental standards in an effort to earn LEED certification.
tag-4: LEED is a system for certifying and evaluating sustainable buildings based on their incorporation of features relating to such factors as:
tag-5: LEED certification confirms a structure's reduced environmental impact in terms of energy and water consumption and carbon dioxide emissions. It not only acknowledges buildings that are environmentally friendly but also evaluates their impact on improving environmental quality, a consideration that in this case contributes to increased productivity among the 50 Citi employees who work in the new offices.
tag-6: The initiative is part of Citi's environmental commitment, which won it Bloomberg magazine's prestigious award as the world's greenest bank in 2012 in recognition of its efforts in this area.
tag-7: "We at Citi are proud to be the first bank in Honduras to receive this important certification," remarked Alexa Foglia, Citi Transactional Services Head at Citi Honduras. "Environmental protection is another way for us to contribute to the communities where we operate."
